IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MIND TRUST WAS FOUNDED IN 2006 WITH THE GOAL OF TRANSFORMING INDIANAPOLIS' K-12 EDUCATION LANDSCAPE TO ENSURE THAT ALL INDIANAPOLIS STUDENTS HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO RECEIVE A HIGH-QUALITY EDUCATION. OVER THE LAST 16 YEARS, THE MIND TRUST HAS SUPPORTED THE LAUNCH OF 45 PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND 15 EDUCATION NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST INVESTS IN PUBLIC EDUCATION TO TRANSFORM LIVES IN NEIGHBORHOODS ACROSS INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST WORKS TOWARD A DAY WHEN RACE AND INCOME ARE NO LONGER PREDICTORS OF LIFE OUTCOMES. THE MIND TRUST EXECUTES ON THIS GOAL BY CONTINUOUSLY PURSUING RACIAL EQUITY; ENSURING STUDENTS HAVE ACCESS TO HIGH-QUALITY SCHOOLS AND EDUCATORS; EMPOWERING FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES; AND SUSTAINING A STRONG EDUCATION LANDSCAPE IN INDIANAPOLIS THEREBY SUPPORTING, BENEFITTING, AND PERFORMING THE EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES OF THE UNIVERSITY OF INDIANAPOLIS AND TNTP.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MIND TRUST'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE EVERY INDIANAPOLIS STUDENT ACCESS TO AN EXCELLENT EDUCATION BY AMPLIFYING THE POWER OF NEIGHBORHOODS AND COMMUNITIES TO LEAD EDUCATION CHANGE, SUPPORTING SCHOOLS TO GROW AND EXCEL IN A THRIVING EDUCATION ECOSYSTEM, AND DISRUPTING SYSTEMIC RACISM IN EDUCATION. THE MIND TRUST STRIVES TO ENSURE INDIANAPOLIS IS A CITY WHERE EVERY CHILD HAS ACCESS TO AN EXCELLENT EDUCATION, IN PURSUIT OF A DAY WHEN RACE AND INCOME ARE NO LONGER PREDICTORS OF LIFE OUTCOMES BY TRIPLING THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITHIN INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS GEOGRAPHY WHO ARE ACADEMICALLY PROFICIENT BY 2027. USING 2021 AS A BASELINE, THE MIND TRUST'S OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO ENSURE THAT AT LEAST THREE TIMES AS MANY STUDENTS ARE ACADEMICALLY PROFICIENT BY 2027. THE MIND TRUST EXECUTES ON THIS GOAL BY CONTINUOUSLY PURSUING RACIAL EQUITY; ENSURING STUDENTS HAVE ACCESS TO HIGH-QUALITY SCHOOLS AND EDUCATORS; EMPOWERING FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES; AND SUSTAINING A STRONG EDUCATION LANDSCAPE IN IN
IRS990.Desc: THE MIND TRUST OPERATES THREE INCUBATORS - THE INNOVATION SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP, THE CHARTER SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP, AND THE EDUCATION ENTREPRENEUR FELLOWSHIP - THAT HELP GROW HIGH QUALITY PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND EDUCATION NONPROFITS IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE INNOVATION SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP HELPS LAUNCH INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOLS, AUTONOMOUS PUBLIC SCHOOLS WITHIN THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS, THE CITY'S LARGEST SCHOOL DISTRICT, AND THE MIND TRUST'S EDUCATOR EMPOWERMENT AWARDS HELP HIGH-PERFORMING SCHOOLS CONVERT TO INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL STATUS. THROUGH ITS CHARTER SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP, THE MIND TRUST HELPS LAUNCH OR EXPAND EXCELLENT PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS, AUTONOMOUS SCHOOLS THAT OPERATE INDEPENDENTLY OF THE SCHOOL DISTRICT AND ARE FREE FROM MANY STATE REGULATIONS, ALLOWING THEM TO BE MORE INNOVATIVE AND FLEXIBLE IN THE CLASSROOM. THE EDUCATION ENTREPRENEUR FELLOWSHIP LAUNCHES INNOVATIVE, HIGH-QUALITY NONPROFIT EDUCATION ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADDRESS SPECIFIC CHALLENGES FACING LOCAL SCHOOLS AND STUDENTS. THE MIND TRUST AMPLIFIES THE VOICES OF COMMUNITIES TO ADVOCATE FOR EDUCATIONAL EQUITY AND CHANGE BY ESTABLISHING AND ENHANCING PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO ADDRESS BARRIERS FOR MARGINALIZED STUDENTS. TO SUPPORT AND ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY, THE MIND TRUST AWARDS SCHOOL COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP INVESTMENTS TO INCREASE PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN K-12 PUBLIC SCHOOLS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, NONPROFITS, AND CHURCHES IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST ALSO HOSTS COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS, EDUCATION TOURS, AND OTHER EVENTS TO EXPOSE INDIANAPOLIS LEADERS AND STAKEHOLDERS TO THE ISSUES FACING PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST IS COMMITTED TO A CONSTANT PURSUIT OF RACIAL EQUITY WITH A FOCUS ON ELIMINATING THE PREDICTABILITY OF RACE IN DETERMINING A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC SUCCESS. THIS FOCUS AND COMMITMENT ARE INTEGRATED THROUGHOUT THE MIND TRUST'S PRIORITIES GIVEN ITS CENTRAL IMPACT ON STUDENT LEARNING. THE MIND TRUST OFFERS INDIANAPOLIS EQUITY COHORTS, WITH SEPARATE TRACKS FOR SCHOOLS AND SCHOOL NETWORKS AND NONPROFITS THAT ALLOW PARTICIPANTS TO EXAMINE BIAS IN STAFF HIRING AND RETENTION PRACTICES, AND BUILD CAPACITY TO LEAD THEIR ORGANIZATIONS' DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION WORK. THE MIND TRUST ALSO WORKS TO MAINTAIN AND STRENGTHEN THE CONDITIONS FOR STUDENT SUCCESS THROUGH POLICY, ADVOCACY, EFFECTIVE SYSTEM-LEVEL SOLUTIONS, AND COLLABORATION WITHIN THE EDUCATION SECTOR. THE MIND TRUST IS A FUNDING INTERMEDIARY AND LOCAL CHAMPION FOR ENTREPRENEURIAL EDUCATION VENTURES IN INDIANAPOLIS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE MIND TRUST SUPPORTS INDIANAPOLIS PARTNERS TO IMPROVE THE CITY'S EDUCATION ECOSYSTEM AND NATIONAL PARTNERS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF OTHER CITY PROOF POINTS FOR EDUCATION TRANSFORMATION. THE MIND TRUST ENGAGED IN SEVERAL PROJECTS IN THE 2021-22 FISCAL YEAR TO SUPPORT OUR INDIANAPOLIS PARTNERS AND NATIONAL PARTNERS IN THE DEVELOPMENT OF PROOF POINTS IN OTHER GEOGRAPHIES.

LIVING CAMPUS, LLC 2,500.00 CENTER FOR LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT 2,000.00 JEANINE JOHNSON 1,000.00 - FOOTNOTE 2 URBAN YOUTH MINISTRY OF GREATER INDIANAPOLIS INC. 4,250.00 RENISHA MCCARTER 1,500.00 - FOOTNOTE 2 TARYN THOMAS 3,500.00 - FOOTNOTE 2 SHAILA MULHOLLAND 2,000.00 - FOOTNOTE 2 THE PATH SCHOOL 2,000.00 JAMYA LIGGINS-FISHER 4,500.00 - FOOTNOTE 2 RECONSTRUCTION US, INC. 4,900.00 TINDLEY ACCELERATED SCHOOLS 3,000.00 MARLIN JACKSON 3,000.00 - FOOTNOTE 3 JENNA MURRAY FIT & HEALTHY LLC 1,000.00 AUTISM BEHAVIOR CHILDCARE LEARNING CENTER LLC 3,000.00 FOOTNOTE 1 - THE INDIVIDUALS LISTED ABOVE WITH FOOTNOTE 1 RECEIVED EDUCATOR ASSISTANCE OR TEACHER OF THE YEAR AWARDS FROM THE MIND TRUST IN FISCAL YEAR 2022. THESE AWARDS WERE MADE TO INDIVIDUALS TO ENCOURAGE TEACHER RETENTION BY SUPPORTING TEACHERS' CONTINUING EDUCATION AND HONORING EXCELLENT TEACHING IN INDIANAPOLIS IN THE 2021-2022 SCHOOL YEAR. FOOTNOTE 2 - THE INDIVIDUALS LISTED ABOVE WITH FOOTNOTE 2 RECEIVED LITERACY FUND AWARDS FROM THE MIND TRUST IN FISCAL YEAR 2022. THE AWARDS WERE USED TO SUPPORT LITERACY SOLUTIONS FOR FAMILIES IN INDIANAPOLIS IN FISCAL YEAR 2022. FOOTNOTE 3 - THE INDIVIDUAL LISTED ABOVE WITH FOOTNOTE 3 RECEIVED A SCHOOL COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP INVESTMENT FROM THE MIND TRUST IN FISCAL YEAR 2022. THE AWARD WAS USED TO SUPPORT THE MARLINJ28 PROGRAMS TO PROVIDE SERVICES TO INDIANAPOLIS SCHOOLS TO ENCOURAGE STUDENTS TO STAY ON TRACK IN SCHOOL AND COMPLETE HIGH SCHOOL AND PURSUE POST-SECONDARY OPPORTUNITIES.

BRANDON BROWN COMMUNICATED FOR 600 MINUTES WITH INDIANA STATE REPRESENTATIVES ABOUT POTENTIAL LEGISLATION. KRISTIN GRIMME COMMUNICATED FOR 8,673 MINUTES WITH INDIANA STATE REPRESENTATIVES ABOUT POTENTIAL LEGISLATION.

THE MIND TRUST RECOGNIZES A TAX POSITION AS A BENEFIT ONLY IF IT IS MORE LIKELY-THAN-NOT THAT THE POSITION WILL BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION, INCLUDING RESOLUTIONS OF ANY RELATED APPEALS OR LITIGATION PROCESSES, BASED ON THE TAX POSITION'S TECHNICAL MERITS. AT JUNE 30, 2022, THE MIND TRUST DID NOT RECOGNIZE A BENEFIT FROM ANY UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. IT IS DIFFICULT TO PREDICT THE FINAL TIMING AND RESOLUTION OF ANY PARTICULAR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. BASED ON THE MIND TRUST'S ASSESSMENT OF MANY FACTORS, INCLUDING PAST EXPERIENCE AND COMPLEX JUDGEMENTS ABOUT FUTURE EVENTS, THE MIND TRUST DOES NOT CURRENTLY ANTICIPATE ANY SIGNIFICANT CHANGES IN ITS UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS OVER THE NEXT TWELVE MONTHS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE I, PAGE 1, PART I, LINE 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MIND TRUST COMMUNICATES WITH GRANTEES ON A REGULAR BASIS AND MONITORS THEIR GOALS AND OBJECTIVES PER THEIR FUNDING REQUEST. PART II 1(H):THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST 74 MEDIA, INC. IN FURTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT 74 MEDIA, INC. AS IT RELATES TO JOURNALISTIC WORK THAT AIMS TO EXPLORE INNOVATIVE CONCEPTS IN K-12 EDUCATION IN INDIANAPOLIS AND INDIANA. PART II 2(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST ADELANTE SCHOOLS INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST ADELANTE SCHOOLS INC. IN ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING AN INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II 3(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST ALLEGIANT PREP ACADEMY IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST ALLEGIANT PREP ACADEMY IN ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING A CHARTER SCHOOL IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II 4(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST ASPIRE HIGHER FOUNDATION IN FURTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT ASPIRE HIGHER FOUNDATION WITH A GIRLS SUMMER CAMP TO HELP GIRLS ADVANCE THEIR SOCIAL EQUITY, EDUCATIONAL ATTAINMENT AND ECONOMIC POSITION IN LIFE. PART II 5(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST BELIEVE SCHOOLS INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST BELIEVE SCHOOLS INC. IN ESTABLISHING AND OPERATING AN INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II 6(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB IN FURTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS POWER HOUR PROGRAM WHICH IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE RESOURCES AND GUIDANCE TO CLUB MEMBERS FOR HOMEWORK BEFORE SCHOOL. PART 11 7(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST BROOKSIDE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION IN FUTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT BROOKSIDE COMMUNITY DEVELOPMENT CORPORATION WITH ENSURING STUDENTS IN THE BROOKSIDE NEIGHBORHOOD OF INDIANAPOLIS HAVE RELIABLE INTERNET AND ACADEMIC SUPPORT AFTER SCHOOL. PART II 8(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST BUTLER UNIVERSITY IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST BUTLER UNIVERSITY AS THEY RECRUIT, RETAIN, AND DEVELOP A COHORT PROGRAM FOR CURRENTLY LICENSED TEACHERS TO BETTER SUPPORT THE ACADEMIC PROGRESS OF THE ENGLISH LANGUAGE LEARNING (ELL)/ENGLISH AS A SECOND LANGUAGE (ESL) STUDENTS. PART II 9(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE CENTER FOR INNOVATIVE EDUCATION SOLUTIONS, INC. IN FURTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT THE CENTER FOR INNOVATION EDUCATION SOLUTIONS, INC. WITH SUPPORTING THE CONVERSION OF BROOKSIDE SCHOOL 54 TO AN INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL AND ESTABLISH LEARNING HUBS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 2, 1(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST CHARTER SCHOOL GROWTH FUND IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST CHARTER SCHOOL GROWTH FUND IN CONDUCTING AN 18-MONTH RESTART COHORT THAT WILL CREATE A BENCH OF HIGH-PERFORMING RESTART CHARTER MANAGEMENT OPERATORS (CMOS). PART II, PAGE 2, 2(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST CHRISTEL HOUSE ACADEMY, INC IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT CHRISTEL HOUSE ACADEMY AS THEY SEEK TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN TEACHERS BY REMOVING BARRIERS AND PROVIDING VALUABLE BENEFITS THAT IMPACT STUDENTS OF COLOR. PART II, PAGE 2, 3(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST CIRCLE CITY PREPARATORY, INC IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST CIRCLE CITY PREPARATORY, INC IN EXPANDING ITS NETWORK OF SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 2, 4(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE EDISON SCHOOL OF THE ARTS IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST THE EDISON SCHOOL OF THE ARTS IN EXPANDING ITS NETWORK OF SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 2, 5(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST ENROLL INDY, INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST ENROLL INDY, INC. IN DEVELOPING AND ESTABLISHING ITS OPERATIONS AND A UNIFIED ENROLLMENT SYSTEM IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 2, 6(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE GLOBAL PREPARATORY ACADEMY IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST THE GLOBAL PREPARATORY ACADEMY IN EXPANDING ITS NETWORK OF SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 2, 7(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE HERRON CLASSICAL SCHOOLS IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST THE HERRON CLASSICAL SCHOOLS IN EXPANDING ITS NETWORK OF SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 2, 8(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC LIBRARY FOUNDATION IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES. SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC LIBRARY FOUNDATION IN PROVIDING MORE EQUITABLE ACCESS TO E-BOOKS TO HIGH SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS AND MARION COUNTY THROUGH THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC LIBRARY FOUNDATION'S PARTNERSHIP WITH THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC LIBRARY. PART II, PAGE 3, 1(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES. SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN DEVELOPING AND ESTABLISHING THE INDY SUMMER LEARNING LABS FOR STUDENTS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 3, 2(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS EDUCATION FOUNDATION FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST THE IPS EDUCATION FOUNDATION IN ITS EFFORTS TO IDENTIFY AND MODEL POSSIBLE PATHS FORWARD FOR IPS THAT ARE ALIGNED TO THE DISTRICT'S THEORY OF ACTION AND REFLECTS ITS TOP PRIORITY STRATEGIES. PART II, PAGE 3, 3(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST INSTITUTE FOR QUALITY EDUCATION (IQE) IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST IQE IN ITS EFFORTS TO EDUCATE POLICYMAKERS AND THOUGHT LEADERS ON CHALLENGES IN K-12 EDUCATION AND THE IMPACT OF HIGH QUALITY CHARTER SCHOOLS AND INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOLS. PART II, PAGE 3, 4(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST KIPP INDIANAPOLIS, INC IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST KIPP INDIANAPOLIS, INC. IN EXPANDING AND IMPROVING ITS NETWORK OF SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 3, 5(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST LATINX EDUCATION COLLABORATION IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT LATINX EDUCATION COLLABORATING IN BUILDING CAPACITY AROUND LATINX EDUCATORS IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 3, 6(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST LIBERTY GROVE SCHOOLS INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST LIBERTY GROVE SCHOOLS INC. IN DEVELOPING AND ESTABLISHING AN INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL IN INDIANAPOLIS. PART II, PAGE 3, 7(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST MARIAN UNIVERSITY IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST MARIAN UNIVERSITY IN IMPLEMENTING A LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM AND TO SUPPORT MARIAN UNIVERSITYS KLIPSCH EDUCATORS COLLEGE WHICH SUPPORTS STUDENTS OF COLOR PURSUING EDUCATION AS A PROFESSION IN INDIANAPOLIS AND SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A TEACHER CADET PROGRAMS WITHIN CENTER TOWNSHIP AND THE MIND TRUST PORTFOLIO SCHOOLS. PART II, PAGE 3, 8(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST MELANATED LEADERS INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST MELANATED LEADERS INC. IN ITS EFFORTS TO BUILD COMMUNITY AND CAPACITY FOR LEADERS OF COLOR IN INDIANAPOLIS AND BUILD OPPORTUNITIES FOR CANDOR. PART II, PAGE 3, 9(H): THE GRANT IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST MILES OF SMILES DAYCARE IN FURTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT THE MILES OF SMILES' MENTORING PROGRAM WHICH

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 122,500 TO MELANATED LEADERS. PATRICK JONES IS A HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEE OF THE MIND TRUST AND THE FOUNDER OF MELANATED LEADERS. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST MELANATED LEAADERS INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST MELANATED LEADERS INC. IN ITS EFFORTS TO BUILD COMMUNITY AND CAPACITY FOR LEADERS OF COLOR IN INDIANAPOLIS AND BUILD OPPORTUNITIES FOR CANDOR. THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 25,000 TO BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF INDIANAPOLIS.. MAGGIE LEWIS IS A BOARD MEMBER OF THE MIND TRUST AND THE CEO OF BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB OF INDIANAPOLIS. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUB IN FURTHERING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO SUPPORT THE BOYS AND GIRLS CLUBS POWER HOUR PROGRAM WHICH IS DESIGNED TO PROVIDE RESOURCES AND GUIDANCE TO CLUB MEMBERS FOR HOMEWORK BEFORE SCHOOL. THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 634,229.49 TO EMPOWERED FAMILIES. SHANNON WILLIAMS (LEGAL NAME: LESLIE SHEGOG) IS A HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEE OF THE MIND TRUST AND THE BOARD CHAIR OF EMPOWERED FAMILIES. THE MIND TRUST RECEIVED RESTRICTED GRANTS FROM TWO DONORS THAT REQUIRED THE MIND TRUST TO PAY THE FUNDS TO EMPOWERED FAMILIES. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST EMPOWERED FAMILIES INC. IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST EMPOWERED FAMILIES IN ITS WORK TO SUPPORT PARENT AND FAMILY ENGAGEMENT AND ADVOCACY EFFORTS WITHIN INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS' BOUNDARIES. THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 10,000 TO THE LINKS INCORPORATED. SHANNON WILLIAMS (LEGAL NAME LESLIE SHEGOG) IS A HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEE OF THE MIND TRUST AND THE CORRESPONDING SECRETARY OF CIRCLE CITY CHAPTER OF THE LINKS INCORPORATED. THE AWARD IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST THE CIRCLE CITY CHAPTER OF THE LINKS INCORPORATED IN FURTHING ITS CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST THE LINKS INCORPORATED THROUGH PROVIDING MENTORING, ACADEMIC AND PERSONAL SUPPORT TO GIRLS OF COLOR IN LOCAL INNOCATION CHARTER SCHOOLS THROUGH ITS PROGRAMS: REAL WORLD AND REAL GIRLS. THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 168,750 TO TEACH FOR AMERICA. DAVID HARRIS IS BOARD MEMBER OF THE MIND TRUST AND AN ADVISORY BOARD MEMBER OF TEACH FOR AMERICA - INDIANAPOLIS ADVISORY BOARD. THE MIND TRUST RECEIVED A RESTRICTED GRANT FROM A DONOR THAT REQUIRED THE MIND TRUST TO PAY THE FUNDS TO TEACH FOR AMERICA INDIANAPOLIS. THE AWARD IS PROVIDED TO ASSIST TEACH FOR AMERICA (TFA) IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST TEACH FOR AMERICA IN OPERATING ITS TFA-INDIANAPOLIS SITE AND PROVIDE TEACHERS TO INDIANAPOLIS SCHOOLS. THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 790,182.82 TO MONARCA ACADEMY. MIRIAM ACEVEDO DAVIS IS BOARD MEMBER OF THE MIND TRUST AND A BOARD MEMBER OF MONARCA ACADEMY. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST MONARCA ACADEMY IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501 (C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST MONARCA ACADEMY TO LAUNCH AN INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST MADE AN AWARD OF 166,993 TO TNTP, INC. TEQUILLA BROWNIE IS A BOARD MEMBER OF THE MIND TRUST AND CEO OF TNTP, INC. THE MIND TRUST MADE A AWARD OF 25,000 TO CHRISTEL HOUSE ACADEMY. DAVID HARRIS IS A BOARD MEMBER OF THE MIND TRUST AND EXECUTIVE VICE PRESIDENT OF CHRISTEL HOUSE INTERNATIONAL. THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO ASSIST CHRISTEL HOUSE ACADEMY IN FURTHERING ITS EDUCATIONAL AND CHARITABLE PURPOSES UNDER CODE SECTION 501(C)(3). SPECIFICALLY, THE MIND TRUST SEEKS TO ASSIST CHRISTEL HOUSE ACADEMY TO RECRUIT, RETAIN TEACHERS BY REMOVING BARRIERS AND PROVIDING VALUABLE BENEFITS.

THE MIND TRUST'S MISSION IS TO PROVIDE EVERY INDIANAPOLIS STUDENT ACCESS TO AN EXCELLENT EDUCATION BY AMPLIFYING THE POWER OF NEIGHBORHOODS AND COMMUNITIES TO LEAD EDUCATION CHANGE, SUPPORTING SCHOOLS TO GROW AND EXCEL IN A THRIVING EDUCATION ECOSYSTEM, AND DISRUPTING SYSTEMIC RACISM IN EDUCATION. THE MIND TRUST STRIVES TO ENSURE INDIANAPOLIS IS A CITY WHERE EVERY CHILD HAS ACCESS TO AN EXCELLENT EDUCATION, IN PURSUIT OF A DAY WHEN RACE AND INCOME ARE NO LONGER PREDICTORS OF LIFE OUTCOMES BY TRIPLING THE NUMBER OF STUDENTS WITHIN INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS GEOGRAPHY WHO ARE ACADEMICALLY PROFICIENT BY 2027. USING 2021 AS A BASELINE, THE MIND TRUST'S OVERARCHING GOAL IS TO ENSURE THAT AT LEAST THREE TIMES AS MANY STUDENTS ARE ACADEMICALLY PROFICIENT BY 2027. THE MIND TRUST EXECUTES ON THIS GOAL BY CONTINUOUSLY PURSUING RACIAL EQUITY; ENSURING STUDENTS HAVE ACCESS TO HIGH-QUALITY SCHOOLS AND EDUCATORS; EMPOWERING FAMILIES AND COMMUNITIES; AND SUSTAINING A STRONG EDUCATION LANDSCAPE IN INDIANAPOLIS.

THE MIND TRUST OPERATES THREE INCUBATORS - THE INNOVATION SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP, THE CHARTER SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP, AND THE EDUCATION ENTREPRENEUR FELLOWSHIP - THAT HELP GROW HIGH QUALITY PUBLIC SCHOOLS AND EDUCATION NONPROFITS IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE INNOVATION SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP HELPS LAUNCH INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOLS, AUTONOMOUS PUBLIC SCHOOLS WITHIN THE INDIANAPOLIS PUBLIC SCHOOLS, THE CITY'S LARGEST SCHOOL DISTRICT, AND THE MIND TRUST'S EDUCATOR EMPOWERMENT AWARDS HELP HIGH-PERFORMING SCHOOLS CONVERT TO INNOVATION NETWORK SCHOOL STATUS. THROUGH ITS CHARTER SCHOOL FELLOWSHIP, THE MIND TRUST HELPS LAUNCH OR EXPAND EXCELLENT PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOLS, AUTONOMOUS SCHOOLS THAT OPERATE INDEPENDENTLY OF THE SCHOOL DISTRICT AND ARE FREE FROM MANY STATE REGULATIONS, ALLOWING THEM TO BE MORE INNOVATIVE AND FLEXIBLE IN THE CLASSROOM. THE EDUCATION ENTREPRENEUR FELLOWSHIP LAUNCHES INNOVATIVE, HIGH-QUALITY NONPROFIT EDUCATION ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADDRESS SPECIFIC CHALLENGES FACING LOCAL SCHOOLS AND STUDENTS. THE MIND TRUST AMPLIFIES THE VOICES OF COMMUNITIES TO ADVOCATE FOR EDUCATIONAL EQUITY AND CHANGE BY ESTABLISHING AND ENHANCING PARTNERSHIPS WITH COMMUNITY MEMBERS AND ORGANIZATIONS TO ADDRESS BARRIERS FOR MARGINALIZED STUDENTS. TO SUPPORT AND ENGAGE THE COMMUNITY, THE MIND TRUST AWARDS SCHOOL COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIP INVESTMENTS TO INCREASE PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN K-12 PUBLIC SCHOOLS, COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, NONPROFITS, AND CHURCHES IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST ALSO HOSTS COMMUNITY CONVERSATIONS, EDUCATION TOURS, AND OTHER EVENTS TO EXPOSE INDIANAPOLIS LEADERS AND STAKEHOLDERS TO THE ISSUES FACING PUBLIC SCHOOLS IN INDIANAPOLIS. THE MIND TRUST IS COMMITTED TO A CONSTANT PURSUIT OF RACIAL EQUITY WITH A FOCUS ON ELIMINATING THE PREDICTABILITY OF RACE IN DETERMINING A STUDENT'S ACADEMIC SUCCESS. THIS FOCUS AND COMMITMENT ARE INTEGRATED THROUGHOUT THE MIND TRUST'S PRIORITIES GIVEN ITS CENTRAL IMPACT ON STUDENT LEARNING. THE MIND TRUST OFFERS INDIANAPOLIS EQUITY COHORTS, WITH SEPARATE TRACKS FOR SCHOOLS AND SCHOOL NETWORKS AND NONPROFITS THAT ALLOW PARTICIPANTS TO EXAMINE BIAS IN STAFF HIRING AND RETENTION PRACTICES, AND BUILD CAPACITY TO LEAD THEIR ORGANIZATIONS' DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION WORK. THE MIND TRUST ALSO WORKS TO MAINTAIN AND STRENGTHEN THE CONDITIONS FOR STUDENT SUCCESS THROUGH POLICY, ADVOCACY, EFFECTIVE SYSTEM-LEVEL SOLUTIONS, AND COLLABORATION WITHIN THE EDUCATION SECTOR. THE MIND TRUST IS A FUNDING INTERMEDIARY AND LOCAL CHAMPION FOR ENTREPRENEURIAL EDUCATION VENTURES IN INDIANAPOLIS.

LINE 11B THE MIND TRUST'S FORM 990 AND ALL RELATED SCHEDULES, STATEMENTS AND ATTACHMENTS ARE REVIEWED AND APPROVED BY THE FINANCE AND AUDIT COMMITTEE AND THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS PRIOR TO FILING THE RETURNS WITH THE IRS.

LINE 12C THE MIND TRUST'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL EMPLOYEES, OFFICERS, AND DIRECTORS OF THE MIND TRUST. THE MIND TRUST'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS IS RESPONSIBLE FOR OVERSIGHT OF ALL DISCLOSURES OR FAILURES TO DISCLOSE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST AND FOR TAKING APPROPRIATE ACTION IN THE CASE OF ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST TRANSACTION. THE MIND TRUST'S DIRECTOR OF FINANCE AND OPERATIONS REVIEWS THE ANNUAL CONFLICT OF INTEREST DISCLOSURE FORMS COMPLETED BY EMPLOYEES, DIRECTORS AND OFFICERS OF THE MIND TRUST'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS, AND AS NECESSARY, THE MIND TRUST'S OUTSIDE COUNSEL, IN DETERMINING IF A CONFLICT EXISTS. IF AN EMPLOYEE, OFFICER OR DIRECTOR HAS A CONFLICT, HE OR SHE IS EXCLUDED FROM DELIBERATIONS AND DECISIONS RELATED TO THE ISSUE.

ANNUALLY, THE MIND TRUST'S COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REQUESTS THE CEO COMPLETE A WRITTEN SELF-ASSESSMENT AND PROVIDE THE SELF- ASSESSMENT TO THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE REQUESTS FEEDBACK FROM CURRENT AND/OR RECENT EMPLOYEES, AS WELL AS OTHER BOARD MEMBERS, AS APPROPRIATE ON AN ANONYMOUS BASIS TO SOLICIT THEIR INDIVIDUAL INPUT ON THE CEO'S PERFORMANCE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE CONFERS TO DETERMINE PERFORMANCE FEEDBACK AS WELL AS ANY CHANGES TO THE CEO TO RELAY THAT FEEDBACK AND ANY COMPENSATION CHANGE. THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE COMMUNICATES THE PROCESS AND OUTCOME TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS AND SENDS WRITTEN NOTIFICATION TO THE MIND TRUST'S ADMINISTRATION OF ANY ADJUSTMENT IN COMPENSATION, EFFECTIVE JULY 1, OF ANY GIVEN YEAR.
IN APRIL AND MAY OF 2021, THE MIND TRUST CONDUCTED A COMPENSATION STUDY FOR THE HIGHLY COMPENSATED EMPLOYEES INCLUDED ON PART VII OF THE 990.

THE MIND TRUST, INC. MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AS APPLICABLE, AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON WRITTEN REQUEST MADE TO THE ATTENTION OF ITS CEO AND RECEIVED AT ITS CORPORATE OFFICE.
